title-group.article-title: The Effect of Export Subsidies and Import Withholdings (1979-1986)

abstract.p: We heard numerous arguments and counterarguments during the debate that focused on the effect of price fluctuation on foreig trade volume. Using diverse methodologies, the participants gave different answers to the same questions. This article, utilizing the model László Halpern constructed in 1989,1 applies the method of optimally regulating econometric models. The results show that de facto price fluctuation and, specifically, the system of export subsidies and import withholdings, can be used to regulate nonruble-based foreign trade volume. In applying this method, however, it must be taken into consideration that there can be diverse short- and long-range reactions.
